data.text: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, O King,
For thou wast my protector and helper,
And didst deliver me, according to the abundance of thy mercy, and greatness  of thy name,
From the choking of a fire on every side,
Out of the depth of the belly of Gr. Hades.  the grave,
The slander of an unrighteous tongue unto the king.
They compassed me on every side,
And I remembered thy mercy, O Lord,
And I lifted up my supplication from the earth,
I called upon the Lord, the Father of my Lord,
I will praise thy name continually,
For thou savedst me from destruction,
When I was yet young,
Before the temple I asked for her,
From her  flower as from the ripening grape my heart delighted in her:
I bowed down mine ear a little, and received her,
I profited in her:
For I purposed to practice her,
My soul hath wrestled in her,
I set my soul aright unto her,
My inward part also was troubled to seek her:
The Lord gave me a tongue for my reward;
Draw near unto me, ye unlearned,
Say, wherefore are ye lacking in these things,
I opened my mouth, and spake,
Put your neck under the yoke,
Behold with your eyes,
Get you instruction with a great sum of silver,
May your soul rejoice in his mercy,
Work your work before the time cometh,
